title: Spanish Subject Pronouns
description: Learn how to say 'I', 'you', 'he', 'she', and more in Spanish.

pages.title: What are Subject Pronouns?
pages.description: Understand what subject pronouns are and why we need them.

data.text:
Subject pronouns are words like 'I', 'you', or 'they'. They tell us who is doing the action in a sentence.

In English:
- I eat.
- You run.
- She sings.

In Spanish, we also use subject pronouns to show who does something.

pages.title: Spanish Subject Pronouns: Singular
pages.description: Learn how to say 'I', 'you', 'he', and 'she' in Spanish.

data.text:
- Yo = I
- Tú = You (informal)
- Él = He
- Ella = She
- Usted = You (formal)

pages.title: Spanish Subject Pronouns: Plural
pages.description: Learn how to say 'we', 'you all', and 'they' in Spanish.

data.text:
- Nosotros/Nosotras = We (masc./fem.)
- Vosotros/Vosotras = You all (informal, only used in Spain)
- Ellos = They (masc.)
- Ellas = They (fem.)
- Ustedes = You all (formal or in Latin America)

pages.description: Pick the correct Spanish pronoun based on the English meaning.
